objinfo.medium: water-based tempera with a glue and/or gum binder and with pen and ink outlining and shell gold or gold leaf.

provenance.name: Tate Collection
provenance.note: Acquired from Blake or his wife Catherine by Samuel Palmer; given by Palmer to George Richmond between 1873 and 1876; given by Richmond to his son, William Blake Richmond, in 1887; sold by W. B. Richmond to the Tate Gallery (now Tate Collection) in 1920.

objnote.p: Blake included this tempera painting in his 1809 exhibition, number IV in the accompanying [*Descriptive Catalogue*](http://www.blakearchive.org/copy/bb32.d?descId=bb32.d.te.39).
